tags: I am not saying it was not bad
criticize what you will but don’t imply broadcasting it was ‘irresponsible’
summary: “But what message does this send?” the ending of GOT
title: “But what message does this send?” the ending of GOT
body:
There is much to be criticized about the last season of Game of Thrones and I will wholeheartedly agree with most of it but there is one complaint I do not agree with and that is the idea that this story should not be told because it is unethical.

Again and again I saw posts claiming that “It’s an irresponsible story to tell”, “what D&D are doing is dangerous”. “Honestly, what does this ending say about […] people who grew up underprivileged  […] people who have been raped  […] people who have fertility issues […]  people with mental illness”,“what are these unnecessarily grimdark and poorly executed storylines teaching us?[…]  emotions are dangerous. love is something to be overcome. evil will always prevail […] these lessons are depressing. they are pessimistic. they are dangerous.” 

These statements do not primarily address the lack of quality or the abysmal execution of the plot but the underlying messages GOT contains. They imply that the show’s ending is bad because it doesn’t teach viewers the correct lessons. One user spells out what others only suggest:

“this is fucking dangerous. This is saying that media and performance should be prioritised over a message that a piece of art is trying to send.” 

A line of thinking which endorses the age-old idea that fiction should be subservient to a moral, that stories are (primarily) a didactic tool. No matter how well written a story is, it can only be truly ‘good’ if it spreads the correct ideas. This is a surprisingly traditional and paternalistic viewpoint, one that suggests that adult viewers do not have the necessary critical ability to think for themselves and should be protected against such content. 

To be clear, I know that many of the posts I quoted from were born from anger and frustration. I even understand where they were coming from: people were rightly upset about the end of the storylines of Daeneryrs, Jaime, Brienne, Cersei, Jon, Tyrion and Bran.  

However, using moral arguments extraneous to the literary/artistic value to  suggest a fictional product should be banned is not the solution. Yes, the show has its fair share of problems in its depiction of race, women, rape and so on. This is not a recent problem. But I do not need to be protected against ‘dangerous ideas’ in fiction. I am an adult (this is GOT’s target audience) I’m capable of forming my own judgement, of making up my own mind. I do not want others to decide for me what is an acceptable message and what is not. 

If an entire generation of teenagers could read and watch Twilight and come out unscathed then we can handle the ‘dangerous’ ending of GOT.

body:
PSA

Did yall know it was okay to like BOTH Sansa and Daenerys the whole time?

Like yall didn’t have to fight each other and stuff.

You can like how Sansa’s story ended and dislike how Daenerys story ended. Its allowed yall.

summary: Fuck D&D, Dany deserved to hold her baby in her arms
question: Fuck D&D, Dany deserved to hold her baby in her arms
answer: She sure did! They really did her so wrong. D&D thought they were doing something amazing with that last season and they should be called out for the bs they put the characters and actors through.

summary: Remember when Tyrion said they'd all be lost if Dany died when she decided she wanted to fly North? I guess that was true in a...
question: Remember when Tyrion said they'd all be lost if Dany died when she decided she wanted to fly North? I guess that was true in a sense. Congrats D&D, you made a self fulfilling prophecy for the death of your own show.
answer: “If you die we’re all lost!” as she’s on her way to save Jon. Such a villain. I just -

tags: she is just an absolute sweetheart and i love her
everyone should look up to her
summary: Can I just say how much I love Emilia Clarke? In every interview she manages to be respectful to everyone, to the writers, to...
body: Can I just say how much I love Emilia Clarke? In every interview she manages to be respectful to everyone, to the writers, to the fans, to her character. It’s understandable that she’s talking well about David and Dan, they are her friends and it’s never a good idea for an actor to trash the creators of something you were in, but she still defends her character and tries to justify her actions and has nothing but love for Daenerys, but she also didn’t disrespect the fans, when asked about the petition to remake season 8, she just calmly said what she would like to see and acknowledged those fans when they donated to her charity, some other cast members should really take notes, but also a lot of people in the show biz as well.

reblog.comment: Can I just say how much I love Emilia Clarke? In every interview she manages to be respectful to everyone, to the writers, to the fans, to her character. It’s understandable that she’s talking well about David and Dan, they are her friends and it’s never a good idea for an actor to trash the creators of something you were in, but she still defends her character and tries to justify her actions and has nothing but love for Daenerys, but she also didn’t disrespect the fans, when asked about the petition to remake season 8, she just calmly said what she would like to see and acknowledged those fans when they donated to her charity, some other cast members should really take notes, but also a lot of people in the show biz as well.

trail.content_raw: Can I just say how much I love Emilia Clarke? In every interview she manages to be respectful to everyone, to the writers, to the fans, to her character. It’s understandable that she’s talking well about David and Dan, they are her friends and it’s never a good idea for an actor to trash the creators of something you were in, but she still defends her character and tries to justify her actions and has nothing but love for Daenerys, but she also didn’t disrespect the fans, when asked about the petition to remake season 8, she just calmly said what she would like to see and acknowledged those fans when they donated to her charity, some other cast members should really take notes, but also a lot of people in the show biz as well.

It’s understandable that she’s talking well about David and Dan, they are her friends and it’s never a good idea for an actor to trash the creators of something you were in, but she still defends her character and tries to justify her actions and has nothing but love for Daenerys, but she also didn’t disrespect the fans, when asked about the petition to remake season 8, she just calmly said what she would like to see and acknowledged those fans when they donated to her charity, some other cast members should really take notes, but also a lot of people in the show biz as well.
